Keywords: Celebrity , Scientist , Sinister Syndicate
Real Name: Quentin Beck/Daniel Berkhart
Special Powers
ROLE TAG: Secret Identity
ILLUSION GENERATOR: Mysterio may start the game with [SVC] #s002 Illusion Generator equipped (at no cost).
YET ANOTHER SINISTER SIX: Adjacent friendly characters with the Sinister Syndicate keyword can use Shape Change.
WHAT HORRORS DO YOU SEE IN THE SMOKE: Smoke Cloud. // Once per turn, Mysterio can use either Incapacitate or Mind Control as FREE, but only to make a close attack and only to target characters occupying his Smoke markers, regardless of adjacency.

Comments
June 19, 2021
Goop
No he can't incap and MC its one or the other, this was clarified in the rules forum recently. He's still a great piece and like mentioned below with the 2021 rule changes you can now double target with close attacks. So you can throw your smoke cloud real far away and around corners to MC two of them for only 50pts.
March 27, 2021
Redrover454
Already a great piece, but 2021 rule change has made Mysterio a superb 50pt package. To start, he doesn't have to push off of his stealth anymore. Secondly, with multi-target close attacks, he can now target up to 2 people in his smoke instead of just the one. Third, Smoke Cloud has a minimum range of 6 now, which just makes it that much easier to pull off his attacks. Just like in the comics, Mysterio will punch well above his weight if you underestimate him!
October 21, 2020
brennan4
There's a lot to love about this dial, combining the best parts of previous Mysterios, but one thing bugs me. Something feels wrong about Mysterio having 11 attack. Historically Mysterio has had good powers but low attack values, which made making Sinister Syndicate Teams fun. In order to get the most out of the TA you need some figures with high attack but some with low attack- and Mysterio has always filled that role. I do like how the main dial and the secret identity dial feel different. It was a good move on Wizkids' part not to make all secret identity dials miature versions of the main dial. Although the 60 point Mysterio is definitely the Quentin Bek version, the secret identity click are clearly Daniel Beckhart. It's a nice touch. As great as this piece is, I don't know if it strictly replaces the 50 point LE. Sure, you get more powers for the points, and the ability to theoretically make more illusions. But the LE Mysterio can generate illusions at will, while this one needs to succeed at shape change. Battle Fury, Outwit, or just bad luck can result in games where he enver generates any illusions. Plus his illusions don't have the Sinister Syndicate TA.
October 15, 2020
PDiddyKong
Based on the wording of that smoke cloud ability- it says he can as a close action use incapacitate or mind control targeting characters in his smoke markers, but then it says regardless of adjacency. How can he make a close attack regardless of adjacency? By this I'm guessing he can use smoke cloud up to 5 spaces away and then use incapacitate or mind control against characters anywhere in those markers, but treats it as a close action to prevent you using the 2 thunderbolts on his range?
October 10, 2020
mc268
Mysterio is just perfect. Alternating outwit and perplex, a top dial of stealth, super senses and shape change. He had really amazing stats for his cost, and can share them via the TA. His smoke cloud trait is really fun and can help you pull off some pretty crazy moves. I like that he still has mind control and incap on the dial in case his smoke cloud is outwitted. Willpower is something I never expected to see on a dial for Beck, but I can accept it, he goes through a lot in comics and is pretty determined. Glad it’s end dial and not indom though. His equipment is pretty insane and makes him very strong for the cost. I love that he can make bystanders that can incap and tie people up, plus traited shape change. He’s also great on a Spidey team (via Marvella) giving them access to mind control, a useful TA and all his other tricks. Plus you can recreate the Amazing Mary Jane comic. Lastly, I like that the full dial, with the outwit/perplex, super senses and willpower is definitively a Quentin Beck dial, while the secret identity feels more like Daniel Berkhart. They really gave us two different Mysterios on one dial.
September 21, 2020
Slicktrickyrick
[URL="https://win.wizkids.com/bb/viewtopic.php?f=3&t=15850&sid=3a7996bd5890481f9340a0e57a05b2fe"]SVC 036 Mysterio[/URL] WIN Ruling [QUOTE=WHAT HORRORS DO YOU SEE IN THE SMOKE:] Smoke Cloud. // Once per turn, Mysterio can use either Incapacitate or Mind Control as FREE, but only to make a close attack and only to target characters occupying his Smoke markers, regardless of adjacency.[/QUOTE] [QUOTE]Can he target multiple characters with the close attack?[/QUOTE] [B]No. The effect only alters who Mysterio may target, not how many characters he may target.[/B]
September 16, 2020
spider_ham
Mysterio continues to improve. I'd opt to pass on the Illusion Generator and use Nightbringer (equipped in-game) to ensure that he has more targets to Incap.
September 12, 2020
ArsenalADD
@oldtallandugly at no point does it mention or insinuate multiple targets for the attack. "characters occupying his smoke markers" just points out that out of all his possible targets the only valid ones are ones that occupy his smoke markers
September 7, 2020
OldTallandUgly
@SpaceTitanium it does say that he targets “...characters occupying his smoke markers...”, plural, so I would say he can target multiple.
September 4, 2020
SpaceTitanium
no. it's a close attack and unless stated by a power, a close attack doesn't have multiple targets.

With the wording of his second trait, can he target multiple characters with incapacitate or mind control or just one?
